{"abstract": "Warren E. Buffett, dubbed the Oracle of Omaha for his savvy investments in publicly-traded companies, may be facing some competition from buyout shops. BusinessWeek notes that private equity firms, with their coffers bulging with unprecedented amounts of cash, are taking minority stakes in public companies. And, the magazine says, their involvement is causing the halo effect usually reserved for the likes of Mr. Buffett, signaling that there may be a new player to mimic in the market.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2007/03/12/is-private-equity-the-next-oracle-of-omaha/", "snippet": "", "lead_paragraph": "Warren E. {"abstract": "Oracle\u2018s $3.3 billion acquisition of Hyperion Solutions, announced March 1, is turning out to be a very sweet deal for some company insiders. {"abstract": "The biggest thing in mergers and acquisitions this month is Oracle\u2019s $7.4 billion deal for Sun Microsystems. So, I was happy to see that Sun filed its agreement to be acquired by Oracle on Monday evening rather than waiting the full four business days allowed under the Securities and Exchange Commission\u2019s Form 8-K rules. I would like to think they did so out of solicitude for Sun shareholders, but more likely it was done in order to notify any other third-party bidders of the deal protection devices that were included.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2009/04/23/examining-the-terms-of-the-sun-oracle-deal/", "snippet": "", "lead_paragraph": "The biggest thing in mergers and acquisitions this month is Oracle\u2019s $7.4 billion deal for Sun Microsystems. So, I was happy to see that Sun filed its agreement to be acquired by Oracle on Monday evening rather than waiting the full four business days allowed under the Securities and Exchange Commission\u2019s Form 8-K rules. {"abstract": "The Deal Professor looks at the problems Oracle is having in Europe with its acquisition of Sun Microsystems and why this is a time when the regulatory covenants section of an acquisition agreement matter.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2009/10/22/weak-points-of-sun-deal-come-out-in-europe/", "snippet": "The Deal Professor looks at the problems Oracle is having in Europe with its acquisition of Sun Microsystems and why this is a time when the regulatory covenants section of an acquisition agreement matter.", "lead_paragraph": "The European Union\u2018s competition commission is busy reviewing Oracle\u2019s acquisition of Sun Microsystems and has said it may not rule until Jan. 19, 2010. {"abstract": "Mergers and acquisitions languished in the technology sector this year, but bankers and corporate executives expect 2010 to be quite busy as technology companies seek to raise capital, divest noncore assets and acquire rivals.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2009/12/16/tech-ma-expected-to-rebound-after-weak-year/", "snippet": "Mergers and acquisitions languished in the technology sector this year, but bankers and corporate executives expect 2010 to be quite busy as technology companies seek to raise capital, divest noncore assets and acquire rivals.", "lead_paragraph": "Mergers and acquisitions languished in the technology sector this year as company valuations fluctuated wildly with the economy. {"abstract": "Mark Hurd will bring operational expertise to Oracle, as well as inside knowledge of its rival Hewlett-Packard.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2010/09/08/business/08views.html", "snippet": "Mark Hurd will bring operational expertise to Oracle, as well as inside knowledge of its rival Hewlett-Packard.", "lead_paragraph": "Lawrence Ellison, chief executive of Oracle, has begun another phase of his battle with Silicon Valley. By now hiring Mr. Hurd, Mr. Ellison has backed up his words. {"abstract": "Shareholders liked Warren Buffett\u2019s stock buyback decision, but what\u2019s good for Mr. Buffett might not be so good for other corporate bosses.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/27/business/how-to-mimic-berkshires-bet-breakingviews.html", "snippet": "Shareholders liked Warren Buffett\u2019s stock buyback decision, but what\u2019s good for Mr. Buffett might not be so good for other corporate bosses.", "lead_paragraph": "Warren Buffett isn\u2019t too old to try something new. His Berkshire Hathaway conglomerate said on Monday that it might buy back an unlimited amount of both classes of shares, at up to a 10 percent premium over book value. Many investors like to copy what Mr. Buffett does, but stock repurchases are best left to the Oracle of Omaha. If shares of other companies were truly undervalued, Berkshire probably wouldn\u2019t be buying its own.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "How to Mimic Berkshire\u2019s Bet", "kicker": "Reuters Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "How to Mimic Berkshire\u2019s Bet", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Stocks and Bonds", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Life Insurance", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Berkshire Hathaway Inc", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Buffett, Warren E", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Insurance", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-09-27T01:21:34+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Agnes T. {"abstract": "Lawrence Ellison, the chief executive of Oracle, has been buying companies, but must maintain its edge.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/06/business/ciscos-lesson-for-oracle.html", "snippet": "Lawrence Ellison, the chief executive of Oracle, has been buying companies, but must maintain its edge.", "lead_paragraph": "Empires built through acquisitions can run into problems as they sprawl. That\u2019s doubly so in technology, where obsolescence is a risk. Oracle has used profits from its database stronghold to expand. Its acquisitions have worked well so far \u2014 that\u2019s one reason its German archrival SAP has become more active itself, buying SuccessFactors for $3.4 billion on Saturday. But the sad experience undergone recently by Cisco Systems suggests that Oracle\u2019s boss, Lawrence Ellison, needs to stay on his toes.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [{"rank": 0, "subtype": "jumbo", "caption": null, "credit": null, "type": "image", "url": "images/2011/12/06/business/Views/Views-jumbo.jpg", "height": 859, "width": 904, "subType": "jumbo", "crop_name": "jumbo", "legacy": {}}], "headline": {"main": "Cisco\u2019s Lesson for Oracle", "kicker": "Reuters Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Cisco\u2019s Lesson In Losing Focus", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Citigroup Inc", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Oracle Corporation", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Securities and Exchange Commission", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Stocks and Bonds", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Ellison, Lawrence J", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Cisco Systems Inc", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-12-06T02:36:18+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Robert Cyran and Reynolds Holding", "person": [{"firstname": "Robert", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Cyran", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}, {"firstname": "Reynolds", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Holding", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 2}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/2b9fa5b7-6395-5d82-8163-f6ed9013f958", "word_count": 742, "uri": "nyt://article/2b9fa5b7-6395-5d82-8163-f6ed9013f958"}

{"abstract": "Data will include housing starts and existing home sales for November, and the final third-quarter G.D.P., and companies reporting results will include Oracle, General Mills and Research in Motion.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/12/17/business/economic-reports-for-the-week-of-dec-17.html", "snippet": "Data will include housing starts and existing home sales for November, and the final third-quarter G.D.P., and companies reporting results will include Oracle, General Mills and Research in Motion.", "lead_paragraph": "ECONOMIC REPORTS Data to be released this week includes the current account deficit for the third quarter (Tuesday); housing starts for November (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims, final third-quarter G.D.P., existing home sales for November, the Philadelphia Fed index, and leading economic indicators for November (Thursday); and personal income and spending for November and the Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for December (Friday).", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Economic Reports for the Week Ahead", "kicker": "Looking Ahead", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Economic Reports for the Week Ahead", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Economic Conditions and Trends", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "United States Economy", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Company Reports", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2012-12-16T21:55:22+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "", "person": [], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Schedule", "_id": "nyt://article/28018ddf-c55b-58d8-8406-9527b067eb6d", "word_count": 241, "uri": "nyt://article/28018ddf-c55b-58d8-8406-9527b067eb6d"}

{"abstract": "The stock exchange SecondMarket is turning to the next new thing: bitcoin. | Regulators missed an opportunity in going after JPMorgan, a columnist writes. | Detroit\u2019s municipal pension fund made payments for decades above and beyond normal benefits. | Larry Ellison\u2019s Oracle Team USA achieved victory in the 34th America\u2019s Cup.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2013/09/26/morning-agenda-a-fund-for-bitcoins/", "snippet": "The stock exchange SecondMarket is turning to the next new thing: bitcoin. | Regulators missed an opportunity in going after JPMorgan, a columnist writes. | Detroit\u2019s municipal pension fund made payments for decades above and beyond normal benefit...", "lead_paragraph": "The upstart stock exchange SecondMarket, which made a name for itself allowing investors to buy shares of private companies, is turning to the next new thing: bitcoin. On Thursday, SecondMarket is expected to begin raising money for an investment fund \u2014 the first of its kind in the United States \u2014 that will hold only bitcoins, allowing wealthy investors to bet on the future price of the trendy but much debated virtual currency, Peter Lattman and Nathaniel Popper report in DealBook. The fund will be called the Bitcoin Investment Trust.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "A Fund for Bitcoins", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2013-09-26T11:59:33+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By William Alden", "person": [{"firstname": "William", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Alden", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/cd93f7d3-eec7-5ee9-b0f3-e123db829f6f", "word_count": 1687, "uri": "nyt://article/cd93f7d3-eec7-5ee9-b0f3-e123db829f6f"}

Ellison announced his retirement as chief executive of ...", "lead_paragraph": "ALIBABA MAKES ITS DEBUT | The Alibaba Group raised nearly $21.8 billion in its initial public offering last night, as investors rushed to buy a piece of the company that is poised to continue dominating China\u2019s burgeoning e-commerce industry, DealBook\u2019s Michael J. de la Merced reports. The shares priced at $68 each, the top of an already raised range, giving the e-commerce behemoth a market value of about $168 billion \u2014 much more than eBay, Twitter and LinkedIn combined. {"abstract": "Despite rules empowering shareholders to rein in soaring pay packages, few have chosen to do so, perhaps because of a rising stock market.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/17/business/shareholders-votes-have-done-little-to-curb-lavish-executive-pay.html", "snippet": "Despite rules empowering shareholders to rein in soaring pay packages, few have chosen to do so, perhaps because of a rising stock market.", "lead_paragraph": "It\u2019s been five years since the Dodd-Frank law required that companies let investors vote on their executive pay practices. {"abstract": "This week, the Fed announces whether it will raise interest rates, contract talks with Detroit\u2019s three automakers enter the final stretch and an election in Greece will help determine its economic future.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/14/business/feds-decision-on-interest-rates-autoworkers-contract-talks-and-a-greek-election.html", "snippet": "This week, the Fed announces whether it will raise interest rates, contract talks with Detroit\u2019s three automakers enter the final stretch and an election in Greece will help determine its economic future.", "lead_paragraph": "Airbus, the European airplane maker, will formally open a jet assembly plant in Mobile, Ala., on Monday, its first such factory in the United States. The move into the heart of Boeing\u2019s home turf is part of a long-term strategy by Airbus aimed at doubling its share of the American market for 150-seat airplanes, which is currently dominated by Boeing\u2019s top-selling 737. Airbus plans to build as many as 36 of its competing A320 and A321 models a year by 2018 and says the Mobile plant has the capacity to double that production. All of the aircraft produced at the site are destined for delivery to American carriers, which are expected to need as many as 4,700 new single-aisle planes over the next 20 years. \u2014Nicola Clark", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Fed\u2019s Decision on Interest Rates, Autoworkers\u2019 Contract Talks and a Greek Election", "kicker": "The Week Ahead", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "United States Economy", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Federal Reserve System", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Automobiles", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "Detroit (Mich)", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Shopping and Retail", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Consumer Price Index", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Oracle Corporation", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Interest Rates", "rank": 8, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "Greece", "rank": 9, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Elections", "rank": 10, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-09-14T00:43:34+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By The New York Times", "person": [], "organization": "The New York Times"}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/eaa3d34e-7b22-5766-8db7-1661074db094", "word_count": 939, "uri": "nyt://article/eaa3d34e-7b22-5766-8db7-1661074db094"}
